agentinfo.description: Basic information about the agent that doesn't belong to the sysinfo audit.

config.description: Either pulls the key-value pairs representing the xAgent configuration or acquires the configuration file, depending on the specified format.

parameters.name: format
parameters.usage: Enter "kvpairs" for configuration key-value pairs or "acquisition" for a config file acquisition. Default is "kvpairs".

configuration.description: HX notifies the agent of the config channel to which it should subscribe. If it's different from the config channel to which the agent is currently subscribed, config pull is triggered.

parameters.name: ConfigChannel
parameters.usage: Config channel to which the agent should subscribe.

cookiehistory.description: Returns a history of Cookies stored on the system.

parameters.name: TargetBrowser
parameters.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, or Chrome).

parameters.name: PathToHistoryFiles
parameters.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

diagnostic.description: This command runs a canned diagnostic script. The full version consists of about 15 audits and acquisitions, among them: system, agent info, process API, log, file acquisitions, registry raw audits, arp, dns, route, raw file listing, and config audit. The simplified version consists of only two: log acquisition and config acquisition. Scripts vary slightly by OS.

parameters.name: format
parameters.usage: Enter "standard" for full diagnostics, the results of which are intended for the support team. Enter "simple" for simplified version of diagnostics, the results of which are intended for customers. Default is "standard".

disk-acquisition.description: Acquires contents of a disk drive.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: The global path of the symbolic link for the disk or volume to acquire. The trailing back-slash is optional. Example: \\.\

parameters.name: Filename
parameters.usage: The name of the file to acquire. Example: PhysicalDrive0

parameters.name: offset
parameters.usage: Specifies the offset in bytes from the beginning of the disk.

parameters.name: size
parameters.usage: Specifies the size to acquire in bytes.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

disks.description: List of physical devices which may be acquired as a Disk Image.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

parameters.name: immediate
parameters.usage: Execute the command immediately without waiting for existing audits to finish. Default value is "false".

driver-memoryacquire.description: Acquires a driver from live memory or from a memory image.

parameters.name: driver name
parameters.usage: The driver name to acquire.

parameters.name: memory file
parameters.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

drivers-modulelist.description: Parses an operating system-maintained list of loaded drivers.

parameters.name: memory file
parameters.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

drivers-signature.description: Scans memory for loaded driver structures.

parameters.name: memory file
parameters.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

parameters.name: enumerate imports
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to enumerate imports of all loaded modules for a given driver.

parameters.name: enumerate exports
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to enumerate exports of all loaded modules for a given driver.

parameters.name: strings
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse a specified driver for strings.

parameters.name: shortest matched string
parameters.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to verify if the loaded drivers are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

parameters.name: raw mode
parameters.usage: Open files for hashing in raw mode.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

eventbuffer.description: Identical to stateagentinspector, except that this audit outputs data in a compact form which allows matching of event properties using IOCs. The input parameters are the same.

parameters.name: intervalStart
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 1. Beginning of collection interval.

parameters.name: intervalStop
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 1. End of collection interval.

parameters.name: eventTypes
parameters.usage: Used for both audit types. Describes event types to report. If not specified, all types are returned.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerType
parameters.usage: Used for both audit types. Max number of events per type. Same number used for each type collected.

parameters.name: timeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Time of interest, for events to be collected around.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerTypeBeforeTimeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Number of events to be collected before time of interest.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerTypeAfterTimeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Number of events to be collected after time of interest.

eventlogs.description: Acquire complete listings of the operating system event logs. Enumerates and acquires all logs if none is specified.

parameters.name: eventlog
parameters.usage:
The event logs in which to parse (e.g. Application
System
Security).

parameters.name: eventlogfullpath
parameters.usage: The full path and filename to the event log(s) to parse.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

file-acquisition-api.description: Acquires contents of files using system calls for file access.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: The absolute path of the directory containing the file to acquire. The trailing back-slash is optional. Example: C:\WINDOWS\

parameters.name: Filename
parameters.usage: The name of the file to acquire. Example: notepad.exe.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

file-acquisition-raw.description: Acquires and downloads a specific file using a method that may bypass security or access restrictions and retrieve deleted files.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: The absolute path of the directory containing the file to acquire. Example: 1) D:\ 2) C:\WINDOWS\

parameters.name: Filename
parameters.usage: The name of the file to acquire. Example: notepad.exe:malware.ads

parameters.name: Inode
parameters.usage: The Inode of the file to return. Note: if the inode is not specified and deleted is set to true, the first file encountered is returned.

parameters.name: Deleted
parameters.usage: Acquire deleted files.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

filedownloadhistory.description: Returns a history of files downloaded through a browser.

parameters.name: TargetBrowser
parameters.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, or Chrome).

parameters.name: PathToHistoryFiles
parameters.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

files-api.description: Gathers a list of files using system calls.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional. Examples: 1) C:\ 2) D:\WINDOWS\ (note: escape backslashes).

parameters.name: Regex
parameters.usage: Specifies the Regular Expression a file must match to be returned. You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' ) Examples: 1) Match all files in any subdirectory: .* 2) Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls 3) Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls (note that backslashes must be escaped).

parameters.name: Path Regex
parameters.usage: An alias for the "Regex" parameter.

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: Minimum Sizes
parameters.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Maximum Sizes
parameters.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Filter MD5
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA1
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA256
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files.

parameters.name: Content Regex
parameters.usage: Search files for particular content.

parameters.name: AND Operator
parameters.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

parameters.name: Include Files
parameters.usage: Return file item types.

parameters.name: Include Directories
parameters.usage: Return directory item types.

parameters.name: Include Remote Locations
parameters.usage: Include remote locations such as NFS mounted directories.

parameters.name: Analyze Entropy
parameters.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

parameters.name: Enumerate Imports
parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

parameters.name: Enumerate Exports
parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

parameters.name: Analyze File Anomalies
parameters.usage: Detect higher-order anomalies which may indicate malicious files.

parameters.name: Scan Entry Point Distance
parameters.usage: Specifies the number of bytes from the entry point to scan for jumps.

parameters.name: Strings
parameters.usage: Bool indicating whether or not to parse specified files for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

parameters.name: shortest matched string
parameters.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4.

parameters.name: Get Resources
parameters.usage: Return resources stored in a PE file.

parameters.name: Get Resource Data
parameters.usage: Return all data associated with all resources in a PE file. WARNING: This option can return very large amounts of data even with narrowly-scoped audits. Consider using "Exclude Resource Types" and verifying the size of the results from a single host before running on multiple hosts.

parameters.name: Get Version Info
parameters.usage: Return version information stored in a PE file.

parameters.name: Exclude Resource Types
parameters.usage: List of resource types to exclude when extracting PE resources.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

files-raw.description: Gathers listing of files by directly examining structures on the target system’s disks.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional. Examples: 1) C:\ 2) D:\WINDOWS\

parameters.name: Regex
parameters.usage: Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a key or value name must match to be returned. You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' ) Examples: 1) Match all files in any subdirectory: .* 2) Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls 3) Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls (note that backslashes must be escaped).

parameters.name: Path Regex
parameters.usage: An alias for the "Regex" parameter.

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth.

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Analyze Entropy
parameters.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

parameters.name: Enumerate Imports
parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

parameters.name: Enumerate Exports
parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

parameters.name: Analyze File Anomalies
parameters.usage: Detect higher-order anomalies which may indicate malicious files.

parameters.name: Scan Entry Point Distance
parameters.usage: Specifies the number of bytes from the entry point to scan for jumps.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files.

parameters.name: Minimum Sizes
parameters.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Maximum Sizes
parameters.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Active Files
parameters.usage: Enumerate the active files. Active means non-deleted files.

parameters.name: Deleted Files
parameters.usage: Enumerate the deleted files.

parameters.name: Parse NTFS INDX Buffers
parameters.usage: Parse unused space in NTFS INDX buffers to find previous directory entries.

parameters.name: Filter MD5
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA1
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA256
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash.

parameters.name: Content Regex
parameters.usage: Search files for particular content.

parameters.name: AND Operator
parameters.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

parameters.name: Strings
parameters.usage: Bool indicating whether or not to parse specified files for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

parameters.name: shortest matched string
parameters.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4.

parameters.name: Include Files
parameters.usage: Return file item types.

parameters.name: Include Directories
parameters.usage: Return directory item types.

parameters.name: Get Resources
parameters.usage: Return resources stored in a PE file.

parameters.name: Get Version Info
parameters.usage: Return version information stored in a PE file.

parameters.name: Get Resource Data
parameters.usage: Return all data associated with all resources in a PE file. WARNING: This option can return very large amounts of data even with narrowly-scoped audits. Consider using "Exclude Resource Types" and verifying the size of the results from a single host before running on multiple hosts.

parameters.name: Exclude Resource Types
parameters.usage: List of resource types to exclude when extracting PE resources.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

formhistory.description: Returns a history of forms edited through a browser.

parameters.name: TargetBrowser
parameters.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, or Chrome).

parameters.name: PathToHistoryFiles
parameters.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

groups.description: Retrieves a list of user groups from the target system.

hivelist.description: Lists registry hives for use in a Registry Listing audit. Includes hives which can only be acquired in Raw mode (such as the SAM hive).

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

iocload.description: Potentially forces a check for new intel. Intel channel and intel refresh interval are no longer passed to the agent in this audit; they are now agent configurations (and can be set in the config file).

parameters.name: IntelForceCheck
parameters.usage: Whether to trigger an intel pull immediately.

parameters.name: LastSeenID
parameters.usage: The ID of the last match that was sent; used to avoid sending the same matches every time this audit is run. If this parameter is not included in the script, all matches are returned.

kernel-hookdetection.description: Finds the presence of rootkits using IRP, System Service Descriptor Table Hooks, and Interrupt Descriptor Table Hooks (IDT).

parameters.name: idt
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to verify certain entries in the IDT.

parameters.name: ssdt_index
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to verify the System Service Descriptor Table.

parameters.name: ssdt_inline
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to check System Service Descriptor Table's functions for modifications to their prologues.

parameters.name: drivers
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to check the systems drivers for IRP hooks.

parameters.name: memory file
parameters.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Bool indicating whether or not to verify if the hooked and hooking modules are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

parameters.name: start-time
parameters.usage: Pull the log from this starting time.

parameters.name: end-time
parameters.usage: Pull the log until this end time.

parameters.name: level
parameters.usage: Minimum log level: "DEBUG", "INFO", "NOTICE", "WARN", "ERR", "CRIT", "ALERT", or "EMERG".

parameters.name: message
parameters.usage: Matches log message strings that start with this string.

parameters.name: format
parameters.usage: Select "standard" format for log audit with json output or "textfile" format for log acquisition returning a text file. Default value is "standard".

memory-acquisition.description: Acquires contents of a target system's memory.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.usage: Specifies the offset in bytes from the beginning of physical memory. Note: This will be rounded to the lower page boundary.

parameters.name: size
parameters.usage: Specifies the size of memory to return. Note: This will be rounded to the next page boundary.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: Path where search starts. The trailing back-slash is optional. Examples: 1) C:\ 2) D:\WINDOWS\

parameters.name: Path Regex
parameters.usage: Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a file must match to be returned. You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' ) Examples: 1) Match all files in any subdirectory: .* 2) Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls 3) Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.usage: Number of directory levels to include, with -1 representing full depth.

parameters.name: Minimum Sizes
parameters.usage: The minimum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Maximum Sizes
parameters.usage: The maximum file size (in bytes) of a returned file.

parameters.name: Filter MD5
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific MD5 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA1
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA1 hash.

parameters.name: Filter SHA256
parameters.usage: Filter the results based on a specific SHA256 hash.

parameters.name: Content Regex
parameters.usage: Search files for particular content.

parameters.name: AND Operator
parameters.usage: A file's content must match all regex parameters.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

You must use standard Regular Expression escaping ( '\\' matches a single '\', '\.' matches '.' ) Examples: 1) Match all files in any subdirectory: .* 2) Match .xls files in any subdirectory: .*\.xls 3) Match .xls files in a subdirectory named Temp: .*\\Temp\\.*\.xls

parameters.name: Minimum Sizes

parameters.name: Filter SHA256

parameters.name: AND Operator

network-arp.description: Returns information about entries in the IPv4 and IPv6 Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) tables on a host. Each host maintains its own ARP table necessary for basic network traffic routing. Entries in the ARP table describe mappings from IP addresses to physical interface addresses.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

network-dns.description: Returns DNS records stored in the computer's in-memory DNS cache table, which is maintained by the DNS Client Services windows component (which must be running for the table to be resident). The DNS cache table stores various DNS records that describe recently visited website domains.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

network-route.description: Displays the IPv4 and IPv6 routing tables which store information about how a network destination is routed on a given interface.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

persistence.description: Get details of the persistence locations.

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files.

parameters.name: Analyze Entropy
parameters.usage: Calculate entropy for executable files. High entropy may indicate a packed executable.

parameters.name: Enumerate Imports
parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions imported by executable files.

parameters.usage: Identify modules and functions exported by executable files.

parameters.name: lua_script
parameters.usage: Base64-encoded lua script to execute.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: The absolute path of the directory containing the plist file to acquire.

parameters.name: Filename
parameters.usage: The name of the plist file to acquire. Example: Info.plist.

ports.description: Active and listening ports and, where available, the process associated with them.

parameters.name: IncludeIPv6
parameters.usage: Include ports used by IPv6 connections.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

prefetch.description: Get details of the prefetch files kept in %SystemRoot%\Prefetch.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

processes-api.description: Lists running processes as reported by the operating system.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.usage: Specifies the Process ID (PID) of the process to analyze.

parameters.name: process name
parameters.usage: The first 15 characters of the process name. Cannot be specified in conjunction with PID.

parameters.name: handles
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process handles.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process memory sections.

parameters.name: detect injected dlls
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to detect injected dlls.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

processes-handle.description: Obtains a list of running processes by using Windows system calls to enumerate handles.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.usage: Specifies the Process ID (PID) of the process to analyze.

parameters.name: process name
parameters.usage: The first 15 characters of the process name. Cannot be specified in conjunction with PID.

parameters.name: handles
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process handles.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process memory sections.

parameters.name: detect injected dlls
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to detect injected dlls.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

processes-memory.description: Lists running processes with comprehensive information about imported modules, sections, and other data gathered from advanced memory scanning techniques.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.usage: Specifies the Process ID (PID) of the process to analyze.

parameters.name: process name
parameters.usage: The first 15 characters of the process name. Cannot be specified in conjunction with PID.

parameters.name: handles
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process handles.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process memory sections.

parameters.name: ports
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse the process for open ports.

parameters.name: enumerate imports
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to enumerate imports of all loaded modules for a given process.

parameters.name: enumerate exports
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to enumerate exports of all loaded modules for a given process.

parameters.name: Content Regex
parameters.usage: Only return processes with particular content.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: MemD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file from memory.

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to verify if the loaded modules within the processes address space are digitally signed. This operation can not be performed on a memory image.

parameters.name: raw mode
parameters.usage: Open files for hashing in raw mode.

parameters.name: detect injected dlls
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to detect injected dlls.

parameters.name: strings
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to parse a specified process for strings. If strings is enabled, default string length is 4.

parameters.name: shortest matched string
parameters.usage: Minimum Recognized String Length. Default: 4.

parameters.name: memory file
parameters.usage: The full path and filename of the file that represents the host's physical memory.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

parameters.usage: Only return processes with particular content.

parameters.name: memory file

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation

quarantine-acquire-file.description: Acquire a quarantine file using quarantine ID. The file will be decrypted and sent.

parameters.name: Quarantine ID
parameters.usage: Specify quarantine ID.

parameters.name: path
parameters.usage: Path of user directory for which event data is to be gathered. If no path is specified, data is returned for all user accounts.

parameters.name: URLStringMaxSize
parameters.usage: Size limit in bytes for DataURLString and OriginURLString fields. A value of 0 disables this limit. Default: 102400

quarantine-purge-file.description: Purge a file from quarantine  using quarantine ID.

parameters.name: Quarantine ID
parameters.usage: Specify quarantine ID.

quarantine-restore-file.description: Restore a quarantine file using quarantine ID.

parameters.name: Quarantine ID
parameters.usage: Specify quarantine ID.

parameters.name: Restore path
parameters.usage: Specify restore path, if not specified restore at original location.

parameters.name: Force
parameters.usage: Overwrite existing file at restore path if true, default it will not overwrite and give error.

parameters.name: Purge
parameters.usage: Purge the file from quarantine after restoring the file successfully, default is true.

registry-api.description: Returns a listing of registry keys using standard API methods.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: Top-level Registry key to walk from. Path if specified must include the hive name (such as HKLM).

parameters.name: Path Regex
parameters.usage: Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a key or value name must match to be returned. Examples: 1) Match any key or value in any sub-key of the root: .* 2) Match any key or value named Run in any sub-key: .*\\Run 3) Match any key or value in a sub-key of Services: .*\\Services\\.* (note that backslashes must be escaped).

parameters.name: Value Regex
parameters.usage: Return results only for values that contain data matching a Perl Compatible regular expression, such as "svchost(\d\d)?\.exe". Note that REG_SZ values are automatically converted from UTF16 to UTF8 for comparison, all other values are compared "as-is".

parameters.name: Type
parameters.usage: Control whether keys and values are returned. Valid values for type are "KeysOnly", "ValuesOnly", or "All". Default is "All".

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.usage: Specifies the number of levels to recurse in the tree of keys rooted at root_key. Use -1 to recurse the entire tree. Starting depth is not relative to the hive.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

registry-raw.description: Returns a listing of registry keys using Raw methods which may bypass security and access restrictions.

parameters.name: Path
parameters.usage: Top-level Registry key to walk from. Path if specified must include the hive name (such as HKLM).

parameters.name: Path Regex
parameters.usage: Specifies the Perl Compatible Regular Expression a key or value name must match to be returned. Examples: 1) Match any key or value in any sub-key of the root: .* 2) Match any key or value named Run in any sub-key: .*\\Run 3) Match any key or value in a sub-key of Services: .*\\Services\\.* (note that backslashes must be escaped).

parameters.name: Value Regex
parameters.usage: Return results only for values that contain data matching a Perl Compatible regular expression, such as "svchost(\d\d)?\.exe". Note that REG_SZ values are automatically converted from UTF16 to UTF8 for comparison, all other values are compared "as-is".

parameters.name: Type
parameters.usage: Control whether keys and values are returned. Valid values for type are "KeysOnly", "ValuesOnly", or "All". Default is "All".

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.usage: Specifies the number of levels to recurse in the tree of keys rooted at root_key. Use -1 to recurse the entire tree. Starting depth is relative to the hive (eg \HKLM\SOFTWARE).

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

reprovision.description: Agent reprovisions, saves the newly received certificate and key, and restarts.

services.description: Gathers a list of configured and running services on the target system.

parameters.name: MD5
parameters.usage: Compute the MD5 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA1
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA1 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: SHA256
parameters.usage: Compute the SHA256 hash for each returned file.

parameters.name: Verify Digital Signatures
parameters.usage: Verify the digital signature on executable files.

parameters.name: Preserve Times
parameters.usage: Manually reset last access times for audited files.

parameters.name: raw mode
parameters.usage: Open files for hashing in raw mode.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

shell-history.description: Collects command histories from bash, zsh, and ksh93.

parameters.name: UserList
parameters.usage: List of users whose histories to collect. Collects all users if unspecified.

parameters.name: ShellList
parameters.usage: Limit collection to histories for specified shells.

parameters.name: CommandRegex
parameters.usage: Limit collection to commands matching one of the supplied regular expressions.

parameters.name: IncludeBefore
parameters.usage: Limit collection to command executed before the given value. Commands that do not have an associated timestamp are still included.

parameters.name: IncludeAfter
parameters.usage: Limit collection to commands executed after the given value. Commands that do not have an associated timestamp are still included.

stateagentinspector.description: Retrieves contents of the events database. Two audit types: first uses time interval (start/stop times) and max event count per type, second uses target time and max event counts per type for before and after the target time

parameters.name: intervalStart
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 1. Beginning of collection interval.

parameters.name: intervalStop
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 1. End of collection interval.

parameters.name: eventTypes
parameters.usage: Used for both audit types. Describes event types to report. If not specified, all types are returned.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerType
parameters.usage: Used for both audit types. Max number of events per type. Same number used for each type collected.

parameters.name: timeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Time of interest, for events to be collected around.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerTypeBeforeTimeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Number of events to be collected before time of interest.

parameters.name: maxEventsPerTypeAfterTimeOfInterest
parameters.usage: Used for audit type 2. Number of events to be collected after time of interest.

sysinfo.description: General system information such as network devices, registration information, and local time.

systemrestore.description: Get details associated with each restore point on the system.

parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

tasks.description: List of Scheduled tasks (created via the 'at' command or Task Scheduler).

urlhistory.description: Returns a history of URLs visited. The options "GetThumbnails" and "GetIndexedPageContent" are only available for Chrome.

parameters.name: TargetBrowser
parameters.usage: The name of the supported browser whose history will be extracted (Firefox, Internet Explorer, or Chrome).

parameters.name: PathToHistoryFiles
parameters.usage: The path to a user profile directory, the base profile directory, or a single history file from supported browser types.

parameters.name: GetThumbnails
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to retrieve thumbnail images of websites visited.

parameters.name: GetIndexedPageContent
parameters.usage: Indicates whether or not to retrieve indexed page content of websites visited.

parameters.name: Prevent Hibernation
parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

useraccounts.description: Retrieves a list of user accounts from the target system.

parameters.usage: Prevents the host machine from entering hibernation while this module is executed.

volumes.description: List volumes which may be mounted by physical disks.
